result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary Anton Klein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $8,955.00 to be paid to Rosalie B.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court costs, victim witness surcharges ad DNA surcharge AND restitution  are to be paid by 4/19/2030.  DOC is to take up to 25% of prison funds.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.
Successfully complete a  Cognitive  Thinkning Behavioral Modification course.
Successfully complete a parenting class.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Defendant advised that as  a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant also advised because he has been convicted  of a violent felony, under Section 941.29 if he possess a firearm within five (5) years of completing his felony sentence he will be subject to a mandatory three (3) year Initial Confinement sentence.  Also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt: Denying Motion for Relief from Judgment or Order, signed and filed.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Conen, Br. 30, for review. jbs
Defendant's for relief from judgment of order entered on Sept. 8, 2016.
Decision and Order Denying Petition to Correct Judgment of Conviction, Received and Filed. LNR
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Conen, Br. 30, calendar successor, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se "petition to correct judgment of conviction."

Certification of SENTENCING transcript commencing MARCH 19, 2016 received and filed. (57 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to REQUIRED BY STATUTE. kl

Defendant Zachary Anton Klein in court with attorney Paul Arthur Oberer.  Defendant Zachary Anton Klein in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements by: Rosalie B and Anthony K
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 14 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 9 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS, concurrent to any other sentence, credit for 399 days. Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 4/19/2030, DOC is to take up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 4/19/2030, DOC is to take up to 25% of prison funds;; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution in the amount of $8,955.00 is to be paid to Rosalie B by 4/19/2030, DOC is to take up to 25% of prison funds;; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. Restitution is to be paid before court costs.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course
-Successfulyy complete a parenting class
-Work or school
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; Defendant also advised because he has been convicted of a violent felony under Section 941.29 if he possesses a firearm within 5 years of completing his felony sentence, he will be subject to a mandatory 3 year initial confinement sentence; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. 
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
of Support for the defendant received and filed. sab
Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Zachary Anton Klein in court with attorney Paul Arthur Oberer.  Defendant Zachary Anton Klein in custody.  
Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Final pretrial.  Plea forms submitted.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.
State in compliance with victim rights legislation.  The Court orders restitution held open at this time.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights.  Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor in the future.  Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  

Parties not seeking presentence investigation report.  Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody pending sentencing.  Jury Trial date of 4-18-16 VACATED.  Filed, Jury Instructions, Criminal Complaint, Offer letter.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Paul Arthur Oberer in court, defendant Zachary Anton Klein not in court, in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court is not in session on todays date. Final pretrial is rescheduled.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zachary Anton Klein in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Defendant Zachary Anton Klein in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
An in chambers conference was held. Parties are jointly requesting to adjourn the jury trial. Defendant is currently serving a revocation sentence so there are no speedy trial issues. Case rescheduled for FINAL PRETRIAL and JURY TRIAL in Branch 15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.
FINAL PRE-TRIAL ON WEDNESDAY, DECEMBER 16, 2015 AT 8:30 AM IN BR RM 502 OF THE CIRCUIT COURT OF MILWAUKEE COUNTY.
State's Requested Jury Instructions, received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.
Defendant's Motion in Limine to Allow Testimony to Show that the Decedent may have comitted suicide, received and filed.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions received and filed.

Defendant Zachary Anton Klein in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Defendant Zachary Anton Klein in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court grants defense Motion to adjourn jury trial. Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL and JURY TRIAL in Branch 15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Per parties request, case scheduled for a Status Conference which will be calendared as a Motion Hearing on 9/14/2015 at 8:30. State will produce defendant.

Defendant Zachary Anton Klein in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Defendant Zachary Anton Klein in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Based on the defense written motion and no objection from the State, Court grants the defense motion to adjourn the trial date. Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 9/18/2015 at 8:30 am and JURY TRIAL on 10/19/2015 at 9:00 am in Branch 15. Pretrial Scheduling Order signed and filed.
Defendant's Motion for Continuance received and filed. sab
Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING  (17 pages) commencing MAY 15, 2015 received and filed.

Attorney Paul A. Oberer in court, defendant Zachary Anton Klein not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant will be revoked and serving a prison sentence.
All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15,  in Room 506 of the Safety Building.
Case set for final pretrial on 8-5-2015 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 8-24-2015 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 6-18-2015.

Defendant Zachary Anton Klein in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Defendant Zachary Anton Klein in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Timothy Keller-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is reassigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38 due to the criminal charges in this complaint.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:15 am.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Zachary Anton Klein in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Defendant Zachary Anton Klein in custody.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
